intro: Polygonum bussei, commonly known as the Bessie knotweed, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It is characterized by its erect, slender stems that often branch near the base. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to elliptic, and have a slightly rough texture. Polygonum bussei is often found in moist, disturbed soils along stream banks and in meadows.
